greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle generated from the g.f of A000712 (i.e., 1/(1-x^m)^2) interleaved with zeros.
comment: Row sums of the triangle = A000712.
formula: Given 1/(1-x^m)^2 = S(x) = (1 + 2x + 3x^2 + ...), let a = S(x), b = S(x^2) (i.e., S(x) interleaved with one zero); S(x^3) = S(x) interleaved with two zeros = c, etc.; then row 1 = a, row 2 = a*b, row 3 = a*b*c, ...
Take finite differences of the array from the top down, becoming rows of the triangle.
